handNote.p: Main scribe of the manuscript. A square Anglo-Saxon miniscule, described by Ker as 'handsome'.

This is the hand of the main Rochester reviser. Ker describes the hand as 'sprawling, but firm and well-marked', with e slightly ascending and open at the top. It should be noted that Ker's palaeographical description on p. 367 erroneously states that this hand is responsible for the homily on Paulinus in 'art. 76', but in fact the added Paulinus homily is Ker's art. 75. Digipal terms this hand the 'Principal Corrector'.

Addending hand in dark ink, very uneven and clumsy aspect. Several of this hand's additions are related to ascribing Augustine as a source to a section via marginal comment, e.g. on 120v. This hand often seems to be overtracing and adding to material added by the Rochester Reviser, but on 119v it adds content of its own to the main text of the present homily.
